comment.author: 70251312@N00
comment._content: A National Memorial Service was held on May 11, 1914, in New York City, for the 17 sailors killed at Vera Cruz in April. U. S. President Woodrow Wilson spoke, along with Governor Glynn of New York and Mayor Mitchel of New York City. Story in the New York Times, 5/11/14: query.nytimes.com/mem/archive-free/pdf?res=940CE3DB173AE6...

comment.author: 34904489@N07
comment._content:
Wystan, 

Thanks for your efforts throughout the photographs which document the National Memorial Service of May 11, 1914. We will be able to better link the related images and expand the descriptions, including a date where one is not yet included.
